Your rival sent a secret using RSA, but leaked half their private key digits. Can you recover the message from 2233304155339826006715064260109648367292013632847654466505916791849737028848130409705538140536472936582988725678446804730083036855572386042117720359566859 using this partial key exposure?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=6137132311912992054220936384154863246140333477217016381852452066729367543714038830564054547542006614495739657521862083859816912079414984842619315217221693, e=292313657097493884587436549876802587693294656419557700757345506620315043722804154267319182218042405114706501249247215214411011682594194149613890970997063, partial_p=11029991476286669810

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{bjbzr3b8}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 2233304155339826006715064260109648367292013632847654466505916791849737028848130409705538140536472936582988725678446804730083036855572386042117720359566859
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6137132311912992054220936384154863246140333477217016381852452066729367543714038830564054547542006614495739657521862083859816912079414984842619315217221693, e=292313657097493884587436549876802587693294656419557700757345506620315043722804154267319182218042405114706501249247215214411011682594194149613890970997063, partial_p=11029991476286669810
extra_info: p=69236378637099351955392627546644307742195011550583116805524255031461643429251, q=88640284670008649698817318538672042284018541255100972402911541903763326938943, Ï†(n)=6137132311912992054220936384154863246140333477217016381852452066729367543713880953900747439540352404549654341171835870307011227990206549045684090246853500
subtype: partial_key_exposure
archetype: rsa
